project.name: Interactive Calculator made by Hannah Rose Final Project

custom-block.s: Speak %txt %br with pitch %n %br with rate %n %br with voice %n %br with volume %n %br in language %txt %br wait %b before doing the next command
Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %b
Speak %txt %br with pitch %n %br with rate %n %br with voice %n %br with volume %n %br in language %txt %br wait %b before doing the next command
Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %b
Speak %txt %br with pitch %n %br with rate %n %br with voice %n %br with volume %n %br in language %txt %br wait %b before doing the next command
custom-block.l: what do you want me todo ?

custom-block.s: Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %b

block-definition.comment: Stops the current attempt to recognize what is spoken.

block-definition.s: Listen to the microphone $nl %'handle response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message
block-definition.comment: Listens to the microphone for speech. The first script is run with the recognized text unless an error is encountered then the second script is called with text describing the error.

block-definition.s: Listen to the microphone $nl %'respond as heard' as words are recognised $nl %'handle final response' when recognition completes $nl but if error %'handle error' with error message $nl with language %'language' $nl with %'max alternatives' maximum number of alternatives $nl %'handle alternatives' with the list of alternative recognitions $nl %'handle confidences' with the list of confidences
block-definition.comment: As words are recognised 'respond as heard' is passed what the recogniser thinks it has heard. When it thinks you are finished speaking the 'handle final response' is given the final text. If an error occurs such as 'no-speech' then the error description is given to 'handle error'. 'language' can be its code or name. You can ask for a list of alternative responses to what was spoken that contains at most 'max alternatives'. 'handle alternatives' is given a list of alternatives. 'handle confidences' is given a list of numbers between 0 and 1 where 1 is certainty.

block-definition.s: Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %'report'
block-definition.comment: When something is spoken this broadcasts 'heard something' and sets 'last thing spoken' to the text that was spoken. You will need to create two new variables for this to work: 'last thing spoken' and 'speech recognition error'. Optionally reports errors. The 'stop speech recognition' block will stop the listening as will silence that triggers a 'no-speech' error.

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message
Broadcast speech recognition results and report any errors %b

block.l: I didn't hear anything for a while. Bye. Click the green flag to start listening again.

list.l: . Click the green flag to try again.

block-definition.s: Train with audio buckets %'bucket names' labels $nl add to any earlier training %'add to previous training' $nl optionally add this text to the page %'introduction' $nl then %'do when ready' when returning from training
block-definition.comment: Will display a panel where one can train the system to classify sounds or speech. 'bucket names' are the labels of the classes to train. Optionally one can provide HTML to appear on the page as an introduction. If 'do when ready' is provided those commands will be run when returning to Snap!

Reports the last thing spoken or if there was an error the error message. Note that "no-speech" is an error message while if spoken it will be "no speech". NOTE that this waits for something to be spoken or enough time has passed.

custom-block.s: Listen to the microphone %br %cmdRing when recognition completes %br but if error %cmdRing with error message

block-definition.comment: As it recognises what is spoken it passes the list of label confidences to the 'process confidences' input. If model is "Pre-trained model of 20 words" then it will recognise 'zero', 'one', 'two', 'three', 'four', 'five', 'six', 'seven', 'eight', 'nine', 'up', 'down', 'left', 'right', 'go', 'stop', 'yes', and 'no', Alternatively if model is "User-trained model" then the model trained by running the "Train with audio buckets" block will be used. Use the 'stop listening for audio label confidences' block to stop this.

inputs.input: User-trained modelPre-trained model of 20 words User-trained model

block-definition.s: Load microphone training data from URL %'URL' then %'do after loading'
block-definition.comment: Loads in the training created using the 'Train with audio buckets ..." block where the saved training has been copied to a web server.

block-definition.s: Load microphone training data from file then %'after loading training data'
block-definition.comment: Loads in the training created using the 'Train with audio buckets ..." block . It prompts for the file.
Reports the value of the 'key' in a table that is a list of pairs of keys and values.

block-definition.s: Get predictions using Teachable Machine audio model %'URL' $nl and process each word recognised %'process word predictions' $nl or else if there is an error %'do if error'

custom-block.s: load JavaScript %txt %br and then %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: Ask %'cloud provider' to say what it sees then %'then receive response' and show the picture %'show photo?'

block-definition.comment: Takes a photo and ask the cloud provider to recognize it. Reports the response when it arrives.

block-definition.s: Current image property from %'cloud provider' $nl with %'property name or names' property names
block-definition.comment: Reports a property of the most recent recognition by the AI cloud provider. Visit tinyurl.com/vision-snap to learn more.
Reports the confidence scores for the list reported by 'IBM Watson classes'.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.comment: Reports a list of tags from IBM Watson from the last time it was asked to recognize an image.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.comment: Reports the best caption from the last image recognition that Microsoft did.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.comment: Reports the tags from the last image recognition by Google.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.comment: Reports the confidence scores of the 'Google labels' from the last image recognition by Google.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.comment: Reports the tags of the last image recognition by Microsoft.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.comment: Reports the labels describing the most recent image recognised by the specified vision service provider.

block-definition.s: Do %'handle response' with what %'provider' sees $nl and show the photo %'show'
block-definition.comment: Takes a picture. When the AI vision provider responds runs the blocks on the labels in the response. Can optionally display the photo.

custom-block.s: Ask %txt to say what it sees then %cmdRing and show the picture %s

block-definition.comment: Takes a picture, asks the AI vision cloud provider to classify it, and reports the response when it arrives.

custom-block.s: Do %cmdRing with what %txt sees %br and show the photo %b

block-definition.comment: Reports the confidence scores for each of the labels described in the vision service provider's most recent response.

custom-block.s: Current image property from %txt %br with %mult%txt property names

block-definition.s: Train with all my costumes with label %'label'
block-definition.comment: Send all the costumes of this sprite off to the training tab with the specified label.

custom-block.s: Add costume %obj %br to the training with label %txt %br then %cmdRing with the response

block-definition.s: Ask %'cloud provider' to analyse costume %'costume' then %'receive response'
block-definition.comment: Sends the pixels of the costume to one of the vision recognition service providers and then runs the provided blocks with the respnse.

block-definition.s: Add costume %'costume' $nl to the training with label %'label' $nl then %'process response' with the response
block-definition.comment: Adds the costume to the training set of 'label'. Before calling this the 'Prepare for training images with these labels ..." block needs to be run to specify the list of labels and start up the training tab.

custom-block.s: Analyse costume %obj then %br %cmdRing %br with the list of label confidences

block-definition.s: load camera training data from URL %'URL' then %'do after loading'
block-definition.comment: Loads saved training from the URL.

block-definition.s: load camera training data from file then %'after loading training data'
%'top n' labels for costume %'costume' %'receive labels' with the labels %'receive probabilities' with the probabilities
block-definition.comment: Uses the MobileNet deep learning image recognition model inside your brower. Nothing is sent to the cloud. Note that this model has been trained on 1000 categories but not people.
Reports the 'top n' labels for the costume. Note that this model has been trained on 1000 categories but not people.

custom-block.s: %n labels for costume %obj %cs with the labels %cs with the probabilities

block-definition.comment: Reports the probabilities (or confidences) that the labels for the costume are correct.

custom-block.s: %n labels for costume %obj %cs with the labels %cs with the probabilities

block.comment: Change to percentages with 3 digits accuracy.

block-definition.comment: Reports whether the selected support panel is ready to answer queries from Snap!.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.comment: Open an interface page for different machine learning models.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet tensorflow.js

block-definition.comment: Reports a list of poses. Use 'pose property' to get the locations of body parts and the confidences that the locations are correct.

block-definition.s: Detect objects in costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options' $nl process response %'process detections' $nl and if there is an error %'process error'

block-definition.comment: Reports the objects in the costume together with their boudning box (upper left corner, width, and height), and confidence score. Details at https:/ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-4.html#detection

custom-block.s: Detect objects in costume %s %br with options %l %br process response %cmdRing %br and if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.comment: Reports the bounding box of the detected object in stage coordinates.
Draws the outline of the bounding box.

block-definition.s: display bounding boxes and labels of %'objects'
segmentation and pose of costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options' $nl process response %'process segmentation and pose' $nl and if there is an error %'process error'
segmentation and pose of costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options'
block-definition.comment: Reports information about people in the image. Can include body part segmentation, pose, and a costume colored by type of body part depending upon the 'options'. See https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-4.html#segmentation

custom-block.s: segmentation and pose of costume %s %br with options %l %br process response %cmdRing %br and if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: segmentations and poses of costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options' $nl process response %'process segmentations and poses' $nl and if there is an error %'process error'
segmentations and poses of costume %'costume' $nl with options %'options'
block-definition.comment: Reports information about people in the image. Can include body part segmentations, poses, and a costume colored by type of body part depending upon the 'options'. See https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/AI-Teacher-Guide/chapter-4.html#segmentation

custom-block.s: segmentations and poses of costume %s %br with options %l %br process response %cmdRing %br and if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: Setup camera %'width' %'height' then when ready %'do when camera is ready'
block-definition.comment: Specifies the resolution of the image sent for recogntion.

custom-block.comment: Check if already ready to avoid the 1 second wait

block.comment: Wait a bit more because otherwise a black image is captured.

block-definition.comment: Reports a costume using the camera.

block-definition.s: Analyse costume %'costume' then $nl %'process response' $nl with the list of label confidences
block-definition.comment: 'process response' is passed the confidence scores using the training from 'Train with image buckets ...'
Reports the confidence scores using the training from 'Add costume ... to the training with label ...'

custom-block.s: Analyse costume %obj then %br %cmdRing %br with the list of label confidences

block-definition.s: Train with image buckets %'bucket names' labels $nl add to any earlier training %'add to previous training' $nl optionally add this text %'introduction' $nl then %'do when ready' when returning from training
block-definition.comment: This will launch a training window where you can show the system examples of each of the labels in 'bucket names'. If 'add to previous training' is false then training will start over from scratch. Optionally you can provide HTML that will appear instead of the default on the training tab. Finally one can provide commands that will run when the user returns to Snap! from the training panel.
Reports whether the selected support panel is visible.

inputs.input: training using cameratraining using camera training using microphone posenet

block-definition.s: Prepare for training images with these labels %'labels' $then do %'do when ready'
block-definition.comment: Sets things up for training with these labels but does not display the support window.

block-definition.s: Get prediction for costume %'costume' $nl using Teachable Machine %'type' model %'URL' $nl then do with result %'do with prediction' $nl or else if there is an error %'do if error'
block-definition.comment: The URL should be created by https://teachablemachine.withgoogle.com/train/image The prediction will be the input to the the 'do with prediction' blocks It is a list of lists of the class name and its probability..

custom-block.s: load JavaScript %txt %br and then %cmdRing %br or if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: load JavaScript %'URL' $nl and then %'do after loading' $nl or if there is an error %'do if error'

block-definition.comment: Reports a costume using the camera.

custom-block.s: Create custoume from camera %b and pass it to %cmdRing

block-definition.s: Create custoume from camera %'mirrored' and pass it to %'process costume'
block-definition.comment: Creates a costume from the video camera and passes it the 'process costume' blocks.

block-definition.s: Get prediction for costume %'costume' using Teachable Machine %'type' model %'URL'
block-definition.comment: The URL should be created by https://teachablemachine.withgoogle.com/train/image This reports a list of lists of class names and probabilities or a textual error message.

custom-block.s: Get prediction for costume %s %br using Teachable Machine %txt model %txt %br then do with result %cmdRing %br or else if there is an error %cmdRing

block-definition.s: Stop listening for audio label confidences
block-definition.comment: If any of the blocks listening for speech or sounds are running this stops them.
This reports either the location of a body part as two numbrs between 0 and 100 or the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100.

input.options: confidence it is a person - 0 confidence there is a nose - 1 location of nose - 2 confidence there is a left eye - 3 location of left eye - 4 confidence there is a right eye - 5 location of right eye - 6 confidence there is a left ear - 7 location of left ear - 8 confidence there is a right ear - 9 location of right ear - 10 confidence there is a left shoulder - 11 location of leff shoulder - 12 confidence there is a right shoulder - 13 location of right shoulder - 14 confidence there is a left elbow - 15 location of left elbow - 16 confidence there is a right elbow - 17 location of right elbow - 18 confidence there is a left wrist - 19 location of left wrist - 20 confidence there is a right wrist - 21 location of right wrist - 22 confidence there is a left hip - 23 location of left hip - 24 confidence there is a right hip - 25 location of right hip - 26 confidence there is a left knee - 27 location of left knee - 28 confidence there is a right knee - 29 location of right knee - 30 confidence there is a left ankle - 31 location of left ankle - 32 confidence there is a right ankle - 33 location of right ankle - 34

block.comment: 'property name' ends with hypen and a number and this extracts that number. Add 0 to ensure it is a number and not text.

block-definition.s: pose property %'location or confidence' of %'left or right' %'body part' from %'pose'
block-definition.comment: This reports either the location of a body part as two numbrs between 0 and 100 or the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100.

input.options: eye ear shoulder elbow wrist hip knee ankle nose person

block.comment: Only the nose has no left or right versions.
Property numbers range from 0 to 34 to identify different information in a pose.
Confidence that there is a person at all.
Location extracted from [["x" 1] ["y" 2]]. Coordinates adjusted to go from 0 to 100.

block-definition.s: pose property %'location or confidence' of %'left or right' %'body part' from %'pose' using stage coordinates %'stage coordinates'
block-definition.comment: This reports either the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100 or the location of a body part as two numbers. If 'stage coordinates' is true then the location matches the stage coordinates, otherwise it is between 0 and 100.

input.options: eye ear shoulder elbow wrist hip knee ankle nose person

custom-block.s: pose property %txt of %l using stage coordinates %b
pose property %txt of %l using stage coordinates %b
pose property %txt of %l using stage coordinates %b

block.comment: Only the nose has no left or right versions.
Property numbers range from 0 to 34 to identify different information in a pose.

custom-block.s: extract pose property %n from %l using stage coordinates %b

block-definition.s: extract pose property %'property number' from %'pose' using stage coordinates %'stage coordinates'

block.comment: Confidence that there is a person at all.
Coordinates adjusted to go from 0 to 100.

block.l: return [ "confidence it is a person", "confidence there is a nose", "location of nose", "confidence there is a left eye", "location of left eye", "confidence there is a right eye", "location of right eye", "confidence there is a left ear", "location of left ear", "confidence there is a right ear", "location of right ear", "confidence there is a left shoulder", "location of left shoulder", "confidence there is a right shoulder", "location of right shoulder", "confidence there is a left elbow", "location of left elbow", "confidence there is a right elbow", "location of right elbow", "confidence there is a left wrist", "location of left wrist", "confidence there is a right wrist", "location of right wrist", "confidence there is a left hip", "location of left hip", "confidence there is a right hip", "location of right hip", "confidence there is a left knee", "location of left knee", "confidence there is a right knee", "location of right knee", "confidence there is a left ankle", "location of left ankle", "confidence there is a right ankle", "location of right ankle" ].indexOf(property_name)

block-definition.s: pose property %'property name' of %'pose' using stage coordinates %'stage coordinates'
block-definition.comment: This reports either the confidence that the body part is correctly identified as a number between 0 and 100 or the location of a body part as two numbers. If 'stage coordinates' is true then the location matches the stage coordinates, otherwise it is between 0 and 100.

input.options: confidence it is a person confidence there is a nose location of nose confidence there is a left eye location of left eye confidence there is a right eye location of right eye confidence there is a left ear location of left ear confidence there is a right ear location of right ear confidence there is a left shoulder location of left shoulder confidence there is a right shoulder location of right shoulder confidence there is a left elbow location of left elbow confidence there is a right elbow location of right elbow confidence there is a left wrist location of left wrist confidence there is a right wrist location of right wrist confidence there is a left hip location of left hip confidence there is a right hip location of right hip confidence there is a left knee location of left knee confidence there is a right knee location of right knee confidence there is a left ankle location of left ankle confidence there is a right ankle location of right ankle

custom-block.s: extract pose property %n from %l using stage coordinates %b

block-definition.comment: Will display 'message' in a dialog box with 'title'. User needs to click 'OK' to remove it.
Reports the value of the 'key' in a table that is a list of pairs of keys and values.

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl using the MARY text-to-speech service $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Says message using 'voice' (number or name). 'Volume' is between 0 and 1. Will wait until the speaking is finished if 'wait' is true.
Reports the first voice number that matches all the arguments. If nothing matches tries to find a voice that matches the first argument.

custom-block.s: check for voices %cmdRing if no voices otherwise do %cmdRing

block-definition.s: check for voices %'do if no voices' if no voices otherwise do %'do if voices'
Speak %'message' then %'to do when finished speaking'

block-definition.comment: Use the browser's default voice or Mary TTS to speak the 'message'.

Language to use for speech input and output only if no language or voice is specified. Should be lower case language code, then a hypen, then upper case dialect code. if no hypen is given then dialect code should be the same as the language code. E.g.as with fr-FR or id-ID. Visit Wikipedia IETF language tag for more information.

Allows reading global settings programmatically. Eisenberg's Law: Anything you can do from the user interface you should be able to do in your program, and vice versa. This library is just a beginning; there are many UI controls outside of the Settings menu.

input.options: Project notes Project name User Presentation mode Language Zoom blocks Stage size Stage scale Retina display support Long form input dialog Plain prototype labels Input sliders Execute on slider change Clicking sound Turbo mode Flat design Keyboard editing Visible stepping Thread safe scripts Prefer smooth animations Flat line ends Codification support Inheritance support Hyper blocks support Visible palette

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), ide = stage.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), world = stage.parentThatIsA(WorldMorph); switch (which) { case 'Project notes': return ide.projectNotes; case 'Project name': return ide.projectName; case 'User': return ide.cloud.username; case 'Presentation mode': return ide.isAppMode; case 'Language': return SnapTranslator.language; case 'Zoom blocks': return SyntaxElementMorph.prototype.scale; case 'Stage size': return new List([StageMorph.prototype.dimensions.x, StageMorph.prototype.dimensions.y]); case 'Stage scale': return stage.scale; case 'Retina display support': return isRetinaEnabled(); case 'Long form input dialog': return InputSlotDialogMorph.prototype.isLaunchingExpanded; case 'Plain prototype labels': return BlockLabelPlaceHolderMorph.prototype.plainLabel; case 'Input sliders': return MorphicPreferences.useSliderForInput; case 'Execute on slider change': return ArgMorph.prototype.executeOnSliderEdit; case 'Clicking sound': return !!BlockMorph.prototype.snapSound; case 'Turbo mode': return stage.isFastTracked; case 'Flat design': return MorphicPreferences.isFlat; case 'Keyboard editing': return !!this.scripts.focus; case 'Visible stepping': return Process.prototype.enableSingleStepping; case 'Thread safe scripts': return stage.isThreadSafe; case 'Prefer smooth animations': return StageMorph.prototype.frameRate > 0; case 'Flat line ends': return SpriteMorph.prototype.useFlatLineEnds; case 'Codification support': return StageMorph.prototype.enableCodeMapping; case 'Inheritance support': return StageMorph.prototype.enableInheritance; case 'Hyper blocks support': return Process.prototype.enableHyperOps; default: return which; case 'Visible palette': return ide.currentCategory; }

block-definition.comment: Allows changing global settings programmatically. This block is for Boolean (checkbox) settings; use SET VALUE for numeric or text values. Eisenberg's Law: Anything you can do from the user interface you should be able to do in your program, and vice versa. This library is just a beginning; there are many UI controls outside of the Settings menu.
block-definition.translations: pt:altera o valor da configurao _ para _

input.options: Presentation mode Retina display support Long form input dialog Plain prototype labels Input sliders Execute on slider change Clicking sound Turbo mode Flat design Keyboard editing Visible stepping Thread safe scripts Prefer smooth animations Flat line ends Codification support Inheritance support Hyper blocks support

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), ide = stage.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), world = stage.parentThatIsA(WorldMorph), thisObj = this; if (tf != !!tf) return; try{ ide.savingPreferences = false; switch (which) { case 'Presentation mode': if (tf != ide.isAppMode) ide.toggleAppMode(); break; case 'Retina display support': if (tf != isRetinaEnabled()) ide.toggleRetina(); break; case 'Long form input dialog': if (tf != InputSlotDialogMorph.prototype.isLaunchingExpanded) ide.toggleLongFormInputDialog(); break; case 'Plain prototype labels': if (tf != BlockLabelPlaceHolderMorph.prototype.plainLabel) ide.togglePlainPrototypeLabels(); break; case 'Input sliders': MorphicPreferences.useSliderForInput = tf; break; case 'Execute on slider change': ArgMorph.prototype.executeOnSliderEdit = tf; break; case 'Clicking sound': if (tf != !!BlockMorph.prototype.snapSound) BlockMorph.prototype.toggleSnapSound(); break; case 'Turbo mode': if (tf != stage.isFastTracked) ide.toggleFastTracking(); break; case 'Flat design': if (tf == MorphicPreferences.isFlat) break; if (tf) ide.flatDesign(); else ide.defaultDesign(); break; case 'Keyboard editing': if (thisObj.scripts.focus && !tf) { thisObj.scripts.focus.stopEditing(); } else if (tf && !thisObj.scripts.focus) { thisObj.scripts.toggleKeyboardEntry(); }; break; case 'Visible stepping': if (tf != Process.prototype.enableSingleStepping) ide.toggleSingleStepping(); break; case 'Thread safe scripts': stage.isThreadSafe = tf; break; case 'Prefer smooth animations': if (tf != (StageMorph.prototype.frameRate > 0)) ide.toggleVariableFrameRate(); break; case 'Flat line ends': SpriteMorph.prototype.useFlatLineEnds = tf; break; case 'Codification support': if (tf != StageMorph.prototype.enableCodeMapping) { StageMorph.prototype.enableCodeMapping = tf; ide.currentSprite.blocksCache.variables = null; ide.currentSprite.paletteCache.variables = null; ide.refreshPalette(); } break; case 'Inheritance support': if (tf != StageMorph.prototype.enableInheritance) { StageMorph.prototype.enableInheritance = tf; ide.currentSprite.blocksCache.variables = null; ide.currentSprite.paletteCache.variables = null; ide.refreshPalette(); } break; case 'Hyper blocks support': Process.prototype.enableHyperOps = tf; break; }; } finally { ide.savingPreferences = false; };

block-definition.comment: Allows changing global settings programmatically. This block is for numeric or text settings; use SET FLAG for Boolean (checkbox) values. Eisenberg's Law: Anything you can do from the user interface you should be able to do in your program, and vice versa. This library is just a beginning; there are many UI controls outside of the Settings menu.
block-definition.translations: pt:altera o valor da configurao _ para _

input.options: Project notes Project name Language Zoom blocks Stage size Stage scale Visible palette

block.l: var stage = this.parentThatIsA(StageMorph), ide = stage.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph), world = stage.parentThatIsA(WorldMorph); try { ide.savingPreferences = false; switch (which) { case 'Project notes': ide.projectNotes = value; break; case 'Project name': ide.setProjectName(value); break; case 'Language': ide.setLanguage(value); break; case 'Zoom blocks': if (!isNaN(value)) ide.setBlocksScale(Math.min(value, 12)); break; case 'Stage size': if ((value instanceof List) && value.length()==2 && !isNaN(value.at(1)) && !isNaN(value.at(2))) ide.setStageExtent(new Point(value.at(1), value.at(2))); break; case 'Stage scale': ide.toggleStageSize(value != 1, Math.max(0.1, value)); break; case 'Visible palette': ide.currentCategory = value.toLowerCase(); ide.categories.children.forEach(function (each) { each.refresh(); }); ide.refreshPalette(true); break; }; } finally {ide.savingPreferences = true; };

if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } if (!no_warning) { alert("Any eCraft2Learn command must be run before the " + function_name + " reporter."); } return 0;

block-definition.comment: Returns only after eCraft2Learn library is loaded
Should only be called by Load eCraft2Learn library

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { return true; } if (window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library) { return false; } window.waiting_for_ecraft2learn_library = true; var script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; document.head.appendChild(script); return false;

block-definition.s: Speak %'message' $nl with pitch %'pitch' $nl with rate %'rate' $nl with voice %'voice' $nl with volume %'volume' $nl in language %'language' $nl wait %'wait' before doing the next command
block-definition.comment: Speaks 'message'. Optionally you can provide the pitch (a positive number), rate (a number between .1 and 2), voice name or number (depends upon what voices are accessible from the browser - see 'get voice names'), volume (a positive number), and language code or name. This command will wait until it is finished if wait is true.

block.l: if (typeof ecraft2learn === 'object') { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); } else { var script = document.createElement("script"); script.type = "text/javascript"; script.addEventListener('error', function () { alert("Unable to load https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js. Check your network connection."); }); script.src = "https://ecraft2learn.github.io/ai/ecraft2learn.js"; script.addEventListener('load', function () { ecraft2learn.run(function_name, parameters); }); document.head.appendChild(script); }

block-definition.comment: Reports the part of the first string up to the first instance of the second string inside it. If the second string isn't found, reports the entire first string.

block.l: var world=this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph); if (!("stringLibCaseIndependentComparison" in world)) { world["stringLibCaseIndependentComparison"] = true; }; if (world["stringLibCaseIndependentComparison"]) { var index=string.toLocaleLowerCase().indexOf(marker.toLocaleLowerCase()); if (index<0) {return string}; return string.slice(0,index); } else { var index=string.indexOf(marker); if (index<0) {return string}; return string.slice(0,index); }

block-definition.comment: Reports the portion of the first input string starting after the first occurrence of the second string. If the second string isn't found in the first string, reports an empty string.

block.l: var world=this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph); if (!("stringLibCaseIndependentComparison" in world)) { world["stringLibCaseIndependentComparison"] = true; }; if (world["stringLibCaseIndependentComparison"]) { var index=string.toLocaleLowerCase().indexOf(marker.toLocaleLowerCase()); if (index<0) {return ""}; return string.slice(index+markerlength); } else { var index=string.indexOf(marker); if (index<0) {return ""}; return string.slice(index+markerlength); }

block-definition.comment: Reports the character position (starting from 1) of the beginning of the first input string inside the second input string. If it's not found, reports 0.

block.l: var world=this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph); if (!("stringLibCaseIndependentComparison" in world)) { world["stringLibCaseIndependentComparison"] = true; }; if (world["stringLibCaseIndependentComparison"]) { return 1+sup.toLocaleLowerCase().indexOf(sub.toLocaleLowerCase()); } else { return 1+sup.indexOf(sub); }

block-definition.comment: If input is TRUE, comparisons made by functions in the string library will be case-independent (so "FOO" = "foo"). This is the default. If input is FALSE, comparisons will be exact.
block-definition.translations: pt:altera comparaes ignorando distino minsculas/maisculas para _

block-definition.s: substring of %'str' from position %'start' to position %'end' inclusive
block-definition.comment: Reports the portion of the first input (string) starting at the position given by the second input (counting from 1, like LETTER n OF) and ending at the position given by the third input (also counting from 1). If the third input is empty, reports the portion from the first position to the end of the string. If a position number is negative, counts from the end backward, so -1 is the last character, -2 is the next to last, etc.
block-definition.translations: pt:o texto de _ entre as posies _ e _ , inclusive

block.l: if (end != "") { return str.slice(start-1,end); } else { return str.slice(start-1); }

block-definition.comment: Reports True if the first input string contains the second input string, otherwise false. Comparison is case-independent by default; use USE CASE-INDEPENDENT COMPARISONS to change that.

block.l: var world=this.parentThatIsA(IDE_Morph); if (!("stringLibCaseIndependentComparison" in world)) { world["stringLibCaseIndependentComparison"] = true; }; if (world["stringLibCaseIndependentComparison"]) { var index=string.toLocaleLowerCase().indexOf(marker.toLocaleLowerCase()); return !(index<0); } else { var index=string.indexOf(marker); return !(index<0); }

block-definition.comment: Reports the input text with lower case letters instead of capital letters in the input. Uses the user's locale's rules for case conversion.
